customers.title: Customers
customers.description: Create test customers to simulate billing flows
customers.helpContent: Customers represent the people or organizations that subscribe to your plans. In a real application, customers are typically created when users sign up.
customers.helpNextStep: After creating customers, go to Subscriptions to subscribe them to plans.

setupCatalogFirst.title: Set up your catalog first
setupCatalogFirst.description: Before creating customers, you need at least one Plan and one Price in your catalog. Go to the Catalog section to set these up.

empty.title: No customers yet
empty.description: Create your first customer to start simulating billing flows.

tips.tip1: Use any email address - these are simulated customers
tips.tip2: In Mock mode, customers are stored in your browser
tips.tip3: Each customer can have multiple subscriptions

readyForSubscriptions.title: Ready to create subscriptions
readyForSubscriptions.description: Go to Subscriptions to subscribe these customers to your plans.

modal.title: Create Customer
modal.emailHelp: Use any email - this is just for identification in the playground
modal.nameHelp: Optional display name for the customer

customers.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this customer?

subscriptions.title: Subscriptions
subscriptions.description: Subscribe customers to plans and manage their subscriptions
subscriptions.helpContent: Subscriptions link customers to plans at a specific price. When a subscription is created, it generates invoices and payments automatically based on the billing interval.

prerequisitesNeeded.title: Prerequisites needed
prerequisitesNeeded.needPrice: At least one Price (linked to a plan)

empty.title: No subscriptions yet
empty.description: Create a subscription to see billing in action.

tips.tip2: In Mock mode, payments are simulated instantly
tips.tip3: Try pausing and resuming subscriptions to see lifecycle events

checkEvents.title: Check the Events timeline
checkEvents.description: Look at the bottom panel to see subscription, invoice, and payment events as they happen.

modal.title: Create Subscription
modal.requireCardForTrialHelp: Collect card details now, but don't charge until trial ends

info.title: Creating a subscription will:
info.invoice: Create an invoice for the first period

payment.title: Complete Payment
payment.collectOnlyInfo: Your card will be saved for future payments when the trial ends. No charge will be made today.
payment.cardHelp: Select a test card to simulate different payment outcomes

changePlan.title: Change Plan
changePlan.immediatelyDesc: Change takes effect now with proration
changePlan.downgradeWarning: Downgrading may result in losing access to some features. Make sure your usage is within the new plan limits.

subscriptions.confirmCancel: Are you sure you want to cancel this subscription?

payments.title: Payments
payments.helpContent: Payments are automatically created when subscriptions generate invoices. Each successful invoice payment appears here.

empty.title: No payments yet
empty.description: Payments are created automatically when subscriptions are billed.

tips.tip1: Create a subscription to see payments
tips.tip2: In Mock mode, payments are processed instantly
tips.tip3: Each billing cycle generates a new payment

viewEvents.title: View payment events
viewEvents.description: Check the Events section to see detailed payment.succeeded and payment.failed events.

invoices.title: Invoices
invoices.helpContent: Invoices are generated automatically for each billing period. They track what customers owe and link to payments.

empty.title: No invoices yet
empty.description: Invoices are created automatically when subscriptions are billed.

tips.tip1: Create a subscription to generate invoices
tips.tip2: Each billing period creates a new invoice

viewPayments.title: View related payments
viewPayments.description: Check the Payments section to see the transactions for these invoices.
